{include "affiliate_loader"} Hear straight from D.C. leaders about the importance of this year's election. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

Many members of the D.C. community face higher barriers that can prevent them from casting their votes.

Join an important virtual panel discussion with local leaders working with D.C.'s immigrant, returning citizen, and unhoused communities on Tuesday, October 27, on what obstacles they see their communities facing, what is at stake in this election year, and what we can all do from today until November 3 to ensure everyone has access to their constitutional right to vote in the District of Columbia.

Virtual Discussion:
Making Sure Your Vote Counts

Learn about the issues affecting D.C. residents and how this year's election will impact them.

Tuesday, October 27, 6 – 7:30 p.m.
Zoom Webinar
Details sent after RSVP

  • Cyndee Clay, HIPS

This event is free and open to all. Closed captioning, live ASL interpretation, and live Spanish interpretation will be provided. The discussion will be recorded.

We hope you'll join us!

This election will determine the direction of D.C. – and the country – for the next four years.
